quiz.title: AP Calculus Unit 7: Applications of Derivatives Quiz - Set 2
quiz.subtitle: Critical Points, Optimization & Curve Analysis (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: AP Calculus AB/BC

questions.question: A function f is continuous on [-3, 5] with f'(-1) = 0, f'(2) undefined, and f'(4) = 0. Which x-values must be considered when finding absolute extrema on this interval?
questions.explanation: To find absolute extrema on a closed interval, evaluate the function at all critical points (where f'(x) = 0 or undefined) AND at the endpoints.

questions.question: The derivative of a function g is given by g'(x) = (x+2)(x-1)². On which interval(s) is g decreasing?
questions.explanation: A function is decreasing when g'(x) < 0. Test intervals: For x < -2, g'(x) is negative; for -2 < x < 1 and x > 1, g'(x) is positive.

questions.question: A cylindrical can must hold 1000π cm³ of liquid. To minimize the cost of metal (minimize surface area), what should the ratio of height (h) to radius (r) be?
questions.explanation: From V = πr²h = 1000π, get h = 1000/r². Surface area S = 2πr² + 2πrh. Substitute h, take derivative, set to zero. Solving yields h = 2r.

questions.question: Using the Second Derivative Test on f(x) = x³ - 3x² - 9x + 10, what can be concluded about the critical point at x = 3?
questions.explanation: f'(x) = 3x² - 6x - 9. f''(x) = 6x - 6. f''(3) = 12 > 0, indicating concave up, therefore a local minimum.

questions.question: A particle moves along a line with position s(t) = t³ - 6t² + 9t + 1 for t ≥ 0. When is the particle speeding up?
questions.explanation: Speeding up when velocity and acceleration have the same sign. v(t) = 3t² - 12t + 9, a(t) = 6t - 12. Their signs are both positive only for t > 3.

questions.question: Find the x-coordinate of the point of inflection for the graph of y = xe^{-x/2}.
questions.explanation: Find y'' = e^{-x/2}(x/4 - 1). Set equal to zero: x/4 - 1 = 0 → x = 4. Check sign change of y'' to confirm it's an inflection point.

questions.question: A rectangle is inscribed in the ellipse x²/36 + y²/16 = 1 with sides parallel to the axes. What is the maximum possible area?
questions.explanation: Let corner in QI be (x,y). Area A = 4xy. From ellipse, y = (4/6)√(36-x²) = (2/3)√(36-x²). Maximize A(x)=(8/3)x√(36-x²). Solving yields x=3√2, y=2√2, A=4*(3√2)*(2√2)=48.

questions.question: For the function f(x) = ln(x² + 4), find the interval(s) where the graph is concave upward.
questions.explanation: f''(x) = (8 - 2x²)/(x²+4)². Concave upward when f''(x) > 0 → 8 - 2x² > 0 → x² < 4 → -2 < x < 2.

questions.question: If f'(x) = (x-2)³(x+1)², how many relative extrema does the graph of f have?
questions.explanation: Critical points at x=2 (odd multiplicity 3: sign change → extremum) and x=-1 (even multiplicity 2: no sign change → no extremum). Therefore, 1 relative extremum.

questions.question: You have 40 feet of fencing to build three sides of a rectangular garden, with a long existing wall forming the fourth side. To maximize area, the side perpendicular to the wall should be:
questions.explanation: Let sides perpendicular = x, side parallel = y. Constraint: 2x + y = 40. Area A = x*y = x(40-2x) = 40x - 2x². A'(x)=40-4x=0 → x=10 ft.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! Your analysis of extrema, concavity, and optimization is precise.
scoreMessages.70: Great work! Solid grasp of derivative applications. Review inflection points and applied optimization setups.
scoreMessages.50: Good foundation. Focus on interpreting derivatives for motion and sign analysis for extrema.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing. Core skills are identifying critical points and setting up optimization equations.
